column5: Very sad news, My condolences to your family and friends
Unbearable. My thoughts are with you and your family Alex.
Just a miserable piece of news......Thoughts go out to everyone involved
My condolences Alex to you and your family.  your dad will truly be missed and always remembered  seeya around pauL
Alex, I never met you or your Dad, but from what I've read here, he was quite a man. I'm very sorry for your families loss. You have my deepest condolences.
very sad, my condolences to the whole family.
Perfect picture. Great guy great fish.
I just met Tony & Alex at the G2G on Callandar Bay.  This is tragic.  My sympathies to Alex & the other family members.
Strange how people can feel such a sense of community loss even though most of us have never met. It's what humans do I guess. R.I.P. Tony.
terrible news, my condolences
This is surreal... my condolences to the family...

Wow I heard about this and I didnt like it. Now that it has hit our community so hard I now know why. As othes have said on here Alex, if there is ANYTHING we can do to help thru these hard times just ask..Were all here for you..
My condolences Alex to you and your family. Your Dad was a great guy always a smile on his face.  Stay strong brother he will always be with you
Alex, you and your entire family have my most sincerest condolences. This is devastating news. Hang in there.
I heard about this on the radio coming home from the lake last night  Deepest condolenses to the family & friends.

I'm very sorry for your loss, Alex. Keep your chin up. Time heals everything, and he WILL be with you ALWAYS!  Have there been any more details released on what actually happened?  Incredibly tragic accident.  S.
Sincerest condolences to the family
A sad moment, may the good memories carry you forward.
My deepest condolences to you and your family.  Losing a family member is always tragic, but the memories you shared together will last a lifetime.
So sorry to hear this tragic news.  My condolences to you, Alex, and your family.
Wow this is some sad news...
Very sad to hear about this. Our Condolences to the familys. ss
WOW So sorry to hear about your loss. My condolences.
Wow.  So sad.  My uncle went through on sturgon years ago but I can't imagine loosing my father.  Like others have said if you need anything let us know.
RIP.  Condolences.
My condolences Alex and Family.
Very sad indeed,my condolences
sorry to hear my condolences to the family
Aweful news... condolences...  HH
My condolences to the family.
My condolences to his family and friends
Very sorry to here.My condolences to the family.
Really awful news...my condolences to the family

Here is the obituary as published: God called Antonio on Saturday, February 11, 2012 at the age of 51. He will be held dear in the hearts of his family, relatives, and many friends. Visitations will be held at the Vescio Funeral Homes Ltd. (8101 Weston Rd., south of Langstaff Rd., 905 850-3332) on Tuesday from 6-9pm and on Wednesday from 2-4 and 6-9pm. The funeral mass will be celebrated on Thursday, February 16, 2012 at 9:30 am at St. Padre Pio Roman Catholic Church (5500 Major Mackenzie Dr., and Islington Ave.). Entombment to follow at the Westminster Cemetery (Bathurst St., north of Finch Ave W.).
My condolences to the family.
My condolences to family and friends. Just tragic news.

OMG  I was just talking to him the other day about his applainces. Oh my God, thats is tragic.  My deepest condolences to his familly. If anyone knows him closely, and can relay a message to his wife, please PM me.  RIP my friend.I am heart broken.
I just saw this on the barrie news, so upsetting. So sorry for everyone involved.
Very sad news to wake up to , our thoughts are with the his family and friends .
I can't believe this happen, I'm in shock  My sincerest condolences to Tony's family and friends.
Our condolences to all involved,Chuck and Shelley...
Really terrible news and so very sad.  Condolances to his family.
Thanks for posting Roy. I didn't know the gentleman but my heart goes out to the family, so sorry.
Sorry for the loss,my condolences to his family and his friends.
Very sad, condolances to the family!
Truely sorry to hear of this accident.   We also share our deepest condolences to the families.
Condolences to family and friends.
Terrible terrible news....my condolences to the family and those who called him a friend.

Hey everyone. Thanks for all your condolences. My dad was not like any other man. He loved fishing with a passion. I know he couldent tell you guys but I know he loved all of you guys here on the OFC. He would always be reading post and talking about them. It's. Very hard for me cause I lost my best fishing partner. I miss him already and the fishing season hasent even started. Rip dad I love you
terrible news...my thoughts are with his family and the loved ones left behind...RIP Antonio...

Oh my, I caught part of this on the late news last night and for some reason it gave me an uneasy feeling, this morning I know why.  My sincerest condolences to you Alex, your family and your fathers friends. Very sad.
My condolences to both families. Very tragic
I am very sorry this has happened. I met tony a couple weeks back at the g2g we did not talk a whole lot but he came across a pretty good guy.
My condolences to the families.
Horrible...just awful. My deepest condolences to the families.
Stay strong Alex.  If you need anything, fire me a PM.  Even if you just wanna go cast a few lure this summer.  We're all here for you.!
Very sad news. My condolences to the family and friends
Today I went to the shop to bring back the trailer and there I saw my dad pick up truck all ready to go ice fishing today. It's kills me cause now it hit me.
Alex, I PM'd you last night. The words from this community are not empty. If any of us can help in any way we will.

One of our members, Antonio Mazzuca AKA Motion died today in a snowmobile accident in Bracebridge. Our condolences to his family and friends.  Here's a link to the news report. http://toronto.ctv.ca/servlet/an/local/CTVNews/20120211/snowmobile-crash-near-bracebridge-120211/20120211/?hub=TorontoNewHome
Sorry to hear that Roy... you just never know what tomorrow brings.  Condolences to all involved.
Horrible news.  My sincere condolences to his family.
That is terrible!! My sincerest condolences to his family.
Shocking news. Condolences to the family.
Horrible news.... Condolences to the family and friends.... Thanks for the post Roy..
I feel so sorry for the family.
This sucks we all just fished with him a few weeks ago, my condolences to his family and his son alex
Very tragic.  So so sorry.  Speechless.

I met Tony and his son Alex (fishman2202) for the 1st time before the gtg when we went perch fishing with my 2 year old son Karter. Tony was 1st class al the way. My deepest sympathy to his wife, and children. I am in shock.
It caught my daughters attention today on the news   My sincere condolences to his family
Wow, what tragic news, condolences to the family
Very sad news--condolences to the families
Tragic.  Sincerest condolences.  S.
Oh wow, I never met Tony but by all accounts, he was a great guy and father. Condolences to his family.

Oh my god.  This is horrible.  I feel sick to my stomach.  I'm so sorry Alex that you have to go thru this.  I had a long talk with Tony about his new 2-up snowmobile.  He was very excited to get out on the trails, and do some exploring.  Man....This really sucks.
Here is a picture of Tony and Alex (floater suits) along with some others who attended the gtg.    Tony will be forever honoured in my hut.
I was looking for the same links Blair.  Here's a video of Tony and Alex releasing a slot pickerel.. http://s944.photobucket.com/albums/ad282/guertin/?action=view&current=100_0037.mp4
My sincere condolences to the family & friends.
My sincere condolences to the family and friends. I can't imagine what the family is going through.
my condolences to his family and friends
Dang very sad news my heart goes out to his family
Oh no. What terrible news. I'm lost for words here.
Condolences to family and friends.  Tragic.
Tragic news, my deepest condolences to his family.
